data.title: multi-touch problem on HTC One
data.body:
When touching screen very fast and frequent (50+ times in 5 sec) on HTC One(801e), it would cause the Exception:

E/InputEventReceiver(14112): Exception dispatching input event.
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112): Exception in MessageQueue callback: handleReceiveCallback
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112): java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: length=20; index=20
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidMultiTouchHandler.onTouch(AndroidMultiTouchHandler.java:48)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.android.AndroidInput.onTouch(AndroidInput.java:404)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.View.dispatchTouchEvent(View.java:7193)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTransformedTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:2187)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:1930)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTransformedTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:2187)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:1930)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTransformedTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:2187)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:1930)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTransformedTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:2187)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewGroup.dispatchTouchEvent(ViewGroup.java:1930)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow$DecorView.superDispatchTouchEvent(PhoneWindow.java:2046)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow.superDispatchTouchEvent(PhoneWindow.java:1500)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.app.Activity.dispatchTouchEvent(Activity.java:2454)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow$DecorView.dispatchTouchEvent(PhoneWindow.java:1994)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.View.dispatchPointerEvent(View.java:7392)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewRootImpl.deliverPointerEvent(ViewRootImpl.java:3605)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewRootImpl.deliverInputEvent(ViewRootImpl.java:3534)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewRootImpl.doProcessInputEvents(ViewRootImpl.java:4648)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewRootImpl.enqueueInputEvent(ViewRootImpl.java:4627)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.ViewRootImpl$WindowInputEventReceiver.onInputEvent(ViewRootImpl.java:4723)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.view.InputEventReceiver.dispatchInputEvent(InputEventReceiver.java:196)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.os.MessageQueue.nativePollOnce(Native Method)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.os.MessageQueue.next(MessageQueue.java:131)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:132)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5536)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1074)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:841)
E/MessageQueue-JNI(14112):  at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)
W/dalvikvm(14112): threadid=1: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x410f4540)

I declared an new InputListener object and implemented touchDown() to determine whether an Balloon is hit or not. (see the attach file)
It is no problem on most of mine and my friends' Android devices but HTC One.
Here is the code:

Stage stage;
stage.addListener(new InputListener() {

```
public boolean touchDown (InputEvent event, float x, float y, int pointer, int button) {

    if(!ClassGDX.bGameIsPaused){
        bHitAnyBalloon = false;
        for(int i=iBalloonAmount-1;i>=0;i--){
            float fPointX = balloon[i].getX() + balloon[i].fCenterX;
            float fPointY = balloon[i].getY() + balloon[i].fCenterY;
            double dDis = Math.pow((float)x-fPointX,2) + Math.pow((float)y-fPointY,2) - Math.pow(balloon[i].fRadius,2);
            if(dDis<=0){ //hit the balloon
                    //... do something
                }
            }
        }
    }

    return false;
}
```

});

App name: Balloon Zoo
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.fingerfun.balloonzoo

Thank you very much!

data.title: Added FBO.end(x, y, width, height) method
data.body:
Added parametrised FBO#end(...) method - do the same as end() but that restores the viewport with sizes passed as arguments.

This method will help to remove duplicate glViewport calls after usage of FBO when using non-default viewport.

data.title: Parameters for SelectBox in default skin uiskin.json cause "SerializationException: Field not found"
data.body:
I'm testing the lasest nightly (Dec 16). I copied the skin files from `gdx-tools.jar` to my assets directory. Here is how I create a skin instance:

```
class DefaultSkin extends Skin {
DefaultSkin() {
    super(Gdx.files.internal("assets/uiskin.json"), new TextureAtlas(Gdx.files.internal("assets/uiskin.atlas")));
}
...
```

That produces an exception:

```
Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SerializationException: Error reading file: assets/uiskin.json
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin.load(Skin.java:96)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin.<init>(Skin.java:81)
    at org.tendiwa.client.DefaultSkin.<init>(DefaultSkin.java:11)
    at org.tendiwa.client.DefaultSkin.getInstance(DefaultSkin.java:16)
    at org.tendiwa.client.UiLog.<init>(UiLog.java:20)
    at org.tendiwa.client.UiLog.getInstance(UiLog.java:28)
    at org.tendiwa.client.TendiwaUiStage.initializeActors(TendiwaUiStage.java:67)
    at org.tendiwa.client.TendiwaUiStage.<init>(TendiwaUiStage.java:28)
    at org.tendiwa.client.GameScreen.<init>(GameScreen.java:133)
    at org.tendiwa.client.TendiwaGame.create(TendiwaGame.java:61)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication.mainLoop(LwjglApplication.java:136)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglApplication$1.run(LwjglApplication.java:114)
Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SerializationException: Error reading file: assets/uiskin.json
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.fromJson(Json.java:658)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin.load(Skin.java:94)
    ... 11 more
Caused by: com.badlogic.gdx.utils.SerializationException: Field not found: listBackground (com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.SelectBox$SelectBoxStyle)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.readFields(Json.java:746)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.readValue(Json.java:861)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin$1.readValue(Skin.java:411)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.readValue(Json.java:805)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin$2.readNamedObjects(Skin.java:432)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin$2.read(Skin.java:421)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin$2.read(Skin.java:417)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.readValue(Json.java:835)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.ui.Skin$1.readValue(Skin.java:411)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.fromJson(Json.java:656)
    ... 12 more
```

Deleting parameters `listBackground: default-rect, listSelection: default-select-selection,` from `uiskin.json` helps get rid of the exception.

data.title: Added getKeyFrames() function
data.body: Added getKeyFrames() method to get the array where the Animation's frames are stored.

data.title: Prevented rare crash on Keyboard.isKeyDown
data.body:
Workaround for #1090

This prevents LibGDX from crashing and simply returns false in the rare event Keyboard.isKeyDown accesses an uncreated Keyboard. I'm not sure what causes this because a creation of a Display should trigger the keyboard. This is more of a fail-safe.

data.title: Keyboard occasionally throws exceptions
data.body:
When using the following:

``` Java
if (Gdx.input.isKeyPressed(Keys.SHIFT_LEFT))
```

My program occasionally throws the following exception:

```
Exception in thread "Timer-0" java.lang.IllegalStateException: Keyboard must be created before you can query key state
    at org.lwjgl.input.Keyboard.isKeyDown(Keyboard.java:406)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.backends.lwjgl.LwjglInput.isKeyPressed(LwjglInput.java:224)
```

I am running a nightly that I downloaded about 1 week ago.

data.title: Removed unused imports in AndroidNet
data.body: Eclipse didn't report these for some reason.

data.title: Inverted accelerometer value?
data.body:
In the wiki (https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Accelerometer), stationary device that facing to the sky will have negative Z-axis value. The complete statement:

```
If an axis is pointing straight towards the center of the earth, it's acceleration will
be roughly 10 m/s². If it is pointing in the opposite direction, the acceleration will
be -10 m/s².
```

This is in contrast to Android documentation (http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/sensors/sensors_motion.html#sensors-motion-accel) and what I found in my device, that it should be positive when the device facing the sky.

```
The stationary device will have an acceleration value of +9.81, which
corresponds to the acceleration of the device (0 m/s2 minus the force of gravity,
which is -9.81 m/s2).
```

Was the wiki wrong? Or the implementation of the libgdx should be like in the wiki but failed in some devices?

data.title: TiledMapPacker: multiple  TMX tilemaps input generate wrong results
data.body:
In TiledMapPacker I see two issues:
- when filling the tilesetsToPack the name of the tilesets have to be unique across all the maps. This not not necessarily true as the names can be set by the user.
- The packTilesets method treats the gids of the tiles as if they were unique across all maps but they are only unique inside a single map. Because the gids are then used as index in the atlas file the texture regions get mixed up.

data.title: TiledMapPacker: Fixed atlas index
data.body:
Index is always (gid-1), so the processing order of the tile sets does not matter.

The old logic with the tileidx counter assumed the tilesets in the correct order, starting with the tileset with firstgid=1.

Fixes  #1082

data.title: add getScaledWidth() and getScaledHeight() to Sprite class
data.body:
This is for convenience, but also cuts down on method calls from the following:

``` java
float scaledWidth = sprite.getWidth() * sprite.getScaleX();
```

data.title: Title of Window does not honor y-down setting
data.body: In an y-up environment with an OrthographicCamera the title bar of a Window is drawn correctly on top, in an y-down setup it gets drawn at the bottom.

data.title: glBufferData now correctly handles null as a value for data in LWJGL backend
data.body:
An exception was previously thrown when calling glBufferData with null as a value for data due to a LWJGL not exposing the proper method. The method is now part of LWJGL hence the update.
Also, null for data has never been possible in glBufferSubData so I removed the "blame LWJGL" bit :)

data.title: multiple tilesets | TiledMapPacker | AtlasTmxMapLoader
data.body:
create a map with tiled that has two tilesets, the first one called mapts, the second one collisionts.
it this map is packed with the TiledMapPacker and loaded via AtlasTmxMapLoader all the tiles are wrong.

That's happening because here (https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/0810da18da5bb652a61dd50b6652a6867413e417/extensions/gdx-tiled-preprocessor/src/com/badlogic/gdx/tiledmappacker/TiledMapPacker.java#L255) the list gives the tilesets in alphabetical order and not in the order they were in the tmx file and thus resulting in wrong tile ids (in the tile sets).

The problem could als well be solved by implementing the behaviour stated in AtlasTmxMapLoader ("The atlas must have it indexed regions named after the tilesets used in the map.") which is currently neither done by the Loader nor the Packer.

Update: As well if you use --strip-unused with TiledMapPacker and have properties set on tiles they are set on the wrong tiles

data.title: Removed deprecated wakelock dependence from Android backend
data.body:
Since the wakelock methods we use are deprecated, I looked into the possibility of alternatives without breaking 1.5 compatibility. This solution mimics the same behavior on the screen and is recommend to be used instead. (See http://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/PowerManager.html#FULL_WAKE_LOCK ) 

Note: I did some basic tests, but I didn't go super in depth so this could use some more testing.

Some benefits: 
- Wakelock permission no longer required to use
- Now handled directly by Android system
- Removes the use of some deprecated code
- Google recommends this method as an alternative (See http://developer.android.com/reference/android/os/PowerManager.html#FULL_WAKE_LOCK)

data.title: default.vertex.glsl error
data.body:
With libgdx-nightly-20131212.zip, I'm getting error below.
ERROR: 0:314: 'max' : no matching overloaded function found
ERROR: 0:329: 'max' : no matching overloaded function found

In default.vertex.glsl, there are a couple of places that call 'max'.

float halfDotView = max(0, dot(normal, normalize(lightDir + viewVec)));

After the google search, it seems the first argument to max function should be 0.0 instead of 0.

Thanks.

data.title: Fixes Android's hideStatusBar behavior
data.body: In android if you where to close the app or touch the software buttons they would not hide again. This fixes the behavior by hooking into Android's onWindowFocusChanged

data.title: input bug? unexpected keyDown when mouse drag
data.body:
i use libgdx in my java desktop application, os is win7.

i inherit a calss from InputAdapter.
public class MyInputProcessor extends InputAdapter

in app init:
InputMultiplexer multiplexer = new InputMultiplexer();
multiplexer.addProcessor(new MyInputProcessor ());
other inputprocessor ......
Gdx.input.setInputProcessor(multiplexer);

i press the mouse left button and drag the mouse, when i up the mouse left button,
MyInputProcessor.keyDown() been called two times, with keycode 130 an 31.

is this a bug or i made a mistake in some place?

data.title: just a thought for improving readability of the history :)
data.body:
I've been trying to follow libgdx development a little. When looking at the history it's currently unnecessary hard to do. Often there are merges of single commits that are based on a pretty old branch where a simple rebase could have stacked the commit onto the current master, like:

```
git checkout feature_branch; git fetch; git rebase origin/master
```

when there is a series of commits for one feature then one can keep them together by doing a non-fast-forward merge

```
git checkout master(where master is at origin/master); git merge [--no-ff] feature_branch
```

I think this would help to avoid most of the overlapping branches/merges

Regards,
Hannes

data.title: MeshPart.numVertices wrongly calculated by MeshBuilder
Overactive audio
data.body: hi after plugging in an lgG2 into ddms and reading the logs i noticed that there are some seriously overactive audio logs everytime i set the volume change the pitch or play a sound i noticed the event happens more then once i think it could be either due to the lgG2 android audio implementation or the libgdx one

data.title: Simple method to attach user data in ui elements
data.body: I've found useful in my project to have these methods to retrieve data from a widget in my listeners . i.e. instead to use "if elseif else "to detect which button was pressed and then goto the corresponding screen , i've attached the screen to a button and then, in listener, simple setScreen((Screen)button.getUserData()) .

data.title: Clipping the perspective camera using model batch?
data.body:
I'm trying to do something described here http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/67024/how-to-crop-cameras-viewport

ScissorStack.calculateScissors method uses SpriteBatch.getTransformMatrix() which is unavailable for ModelBatch - how can one achive clipping the viewport using perspective camera and ModelBatch?

data.title: Added a float[] constructor to Matrix3 to match the ones on Matrix4.
Fix PixmapPacker-generated TextureAtlas disposal.
data.body:
Currently, PixmapPacker-generated TextureAtlas's don't correctly dispose. They are doubly-disposed because of a bug introduced in ddc853b124707171261ec5f5c89cafa648be7841.

This adds disposal to the unit test, fixes the bug, and also runs the eclipse formatter on the source files.

data.title: ScrollPane's widget scale problem
data.body:
ScrollPane doesn't count width that his widget could have scale set. So it displays and scrolls as the widget was not scaled.

My wigdet in ScrollPane is Table actually.
My actors on that table have 1080px width background. So I scale the table to fit every screen, but ScrollPane acts like the table was unscaled.
I have managed to edit ScrollPane so it scrolls normally, counting with his widget scale, but the Actors won't draw properly, they disappear too early while scrolling.
